intro: Acer parviflorum, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that appear in spring before the leaves emerge. The tree has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, which turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. The species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in temperate climates.
